course.subject: MECH
course.name: Aviation Economics
course.description: This module aims to provide the students with knowledge on the economic aspects in the aerospace industry and the aviation sector. The module starts with a review on the developments of aerospace section including products and technology. This is followed by market analysis and prediction methods, and introduction to technology readiness levels. Aircraft program development cost, aircraft unit price, airline operating cost, cost differentiations between low cost and major airlines, value-chain of aviation industry. Cost estimation relations, economic implications of environmental impact, engine program cost, and evaluation of new technology development on economics, design methods for economics. Some recent development in value driven design, supply chain management and optimization will also be discussed.

reviews.author: Crystal Wong
reviews.title: Do not choose this course...
reviews.comment_content: analysis the cost of the civil transport by using different method
reviews.comment_teaching: boring, the lecture notes contain Chinese and some foreigner may not be able to read
reviews.comment_grading:
bad grade, first assignment I got 28/30, another two unknown but final grade is B+

The highest grade was A- for master course which is so low

We did not know the marks for second and third assignments
One classmates only submit one assignment and finally got B which is very unfair
reviews.comment_workload:
heavy workload
3 assignments (essay), 30 pages with using 10 front ----30percent
1 presentation---- 10 percent
